alert.note: Alert for Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 3:18PM AKST until March 05 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occurring. Travel will be difficult. Additional accumulations of 1 inch are expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Along the Coast of the Northern Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 6 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...West winds gusting to 25 mph are combining with snow and blowing snow to cause low visibility at Deering, and other areas along the coast. Winds are expected to decrease after 6pm, and conditions start to improve then. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas.
